moves.1. c4: This is my next annotation (Told you they would come quite soon in the first annotation didn't I?) Again, a 1300, and again, he played very well.
moves.4. Nxe5 d6 5. Nf3 O-O 6. d4 Re8 7. g3 c6: ?! not really sure about this move. But I don't really like it because it weakens the c6 pawn.
moves.9. O-O a6: ? This pawn formation doesn't for some reason feel right.
moves.10. Bf4 d5 11. cxd5 Nxd5 12. Nxd5 Qxd5: ? Why has he lined his Queen up with my bishop?
moves.13. Ne5 Qe6 14. d5 Qd6: ?? This is costing him. There is actually a tactic to win an exchange here. It's really funny, because my older bro (he has won the British Title 3 times in a row!) didn't spot this whereas I did. Can you spot it?
moves.15... Qg6: Doesn't really matter where the queen goes.
moves.16. Nxe7+: ! The next move. This forks the king and queen so he has to take.
moves.16... Rxe7 17. d6: !! The winning move. While the pawn on d6 attacks the rook on e7, My lsb is attacking his rook on a8.
moves.17... Rea7: The best move. He's lost an exchange anyway.
moves.19... Bd7 20. Qd5: ! applying more pressure to the back rank.
moves.20... Ra7 21. Rc7: !! This is now completely won for white because the pawn on d6 in unstoppable ( unless black sacrifices his queen, which would be dumb.
moves.24. c8=Q+ Kh7 25. Qde8: and he resigned due to the double threat of Qh8# and taking on c6.
